headline: Berkshire to offload Kraft Heinz: What it means in post-Buffett era
summary: Berkshire Hathaway (BRK-B, BRK-A) is reportedly taking steps to offload its Kraft Heinz (KHC) investment. FBB Capital Partners senior portfolio manager Mel Casey joins Market Domination Overtime with Josh Lipton to discuss what it means for Kraft Heinz and signals about CEO Greg Abel's tenure. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Kraft Heinz Spills Beans on Berkshire's Possible Share Sale; Stock Drops
summary: Kraft Heinz shares dropped after the food company said in a regulatory filing that its biggest stockholder—Berkshire Hathaway—could sell nearly all of its shares.  Kraft Heinz’s Securities and Exchange Commission filing said Berkshire could sell up to 325.4 million shares.  Shares in the maker of Heinz Tomato Ketchup and Kraft Mac and Cheese fell roughly 3.5% in premarket trading Wednesday.

Shares in the maker of Heinz Tomato Ketchup and Kraft Mac and Cheese fell roughly 3.5% in premarket trading Wednesday.

headline: Warren Buffett's successor eyes selling off Berkshire Hathaway's 325 million Kraft Heinz shares
summary: Warren Buffett's successor appears to be considering his first significant move after taking over as CEO this month.  Kraft Heinz warned investors Tuesday that Berkshire Hathaway may be interested in selling its 325 million shares in the name brand food giant that Buffett helped create back in 2015.  Buffett and the Brazilian investment firm 3G Capital orchestrated the merger of Kraft and Heinz back then because they already owned Heinz and believed in the power of their brands.

raw.headline: Warren Buffett's successor eyes selling off Berkshire Hathaway's 325 million Kraft Heinz shares
raw.summary: Warren Buffett's successor appears to be considering his first significant move after taking over as CEO this month.  Kraft Heinz warned investors Tuesday that Berkshire Hathaway may be interested in selling its 325 million shares in the name brand food giant that Buffett helped create back in 2015.  Buffett and the Brazilian investment firm 3G Capital orchestrated the merger of Kraft and Heinz back then because they already owned Heinz and believed in the power of their brands.

headline: Berkshire Hathaway May Sell Stock in Kraft Heinz, Filing States
summary: Berkshire Hathaway  may sell shares from its $7.8 billion equity stake in  Kraft Heinz  according to a prospectus filed late Tuesday with the Securities and Exchange Commission.  The front page of the prospectus says that Berkshire, which received the Kraft Heinz equity as part of a merger of Kraft and Heinz in 2015, may “offer to sell from time to time” shares from that stake.  Berkshire now holds a 27.5% stake in the food company—or 325.4 million shares.

Berkshire now holds a 27.5% stake in the food company—or 325.4 million shares.
